Articles.Content:
I've installed a fresh new 0.25 version and started a new career. The space center is rendered as floating in the sea, and all of Kerbin is missing, but kerbals can still walk on the water where the ground is supposed to be. I've tried various graphics settings and both the 32-bit and 64-bit Linux versions. 0.24 worked fine, just not 0.25.

Any ideas?
Try reinstalling KSP/verifying the game cache if your on steam.

Boostme,

Please see here. We need a bit more info for this one: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

Thanks,

~Claw

Here's the hardware info, build version, log and screenshot:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/sqb28bjf5veo3jy/AABzcx82BT8YIAV72S56mT0aa?dl=0

It was installed from the .zip downloaded from Squad. The sha1sum is:

c25c32df4dc4b263b56bb38b3246312c054852a0 ksp-linux-0-25-0.zip

Any new ideas?

--

update:

I've installed the proprietary NVidia drivers and that fixed the problem. It doesn't explain why the latest update stopped working with the Noveau drivers though.

Edited October 9, 2014 by boostme
are you sure danny2462 hasn't been at your save file?
I've got the same issue. Downloaded from steam. Linux box.

I've got the same issue. Downloaded from steam. Linux box.

Please see this link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

It's very hard to guess what might be wrong without details (such as log files).

Thanks, and welcome to the forums!

~Claw
I've seen the world load slowly, giving the suggestion that this has happened before the world finally pops in, but that always seems to happen.
What's your terrain detail set to? I've heard this in past happening occasionally on the Low setting.

What's your terrain detail set to? I've heard this in past happening occasionally on the Low setting.

Everything is on the highest settings.

I'll see if I can't get appropriate reporting info at some point this evening. As far as settings, it happened on the default settings and everything set as high as possible. Never got around to trying lowest settings.

Please see this link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

It's very hard to guess what might be wrong without details (such as log files).

Thanks, and welcome to the forums!

~Claw

Same issue here exactly. Kerbin has no visible surface. If you fly around your craft will collide with the ground where the ground is supposed to be, but you can't see it.

Version 0.25.0 build id = 00642

screenshot:

Save File: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/71102170/persistent.sfs

Log: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/71102170/Player.log

System Specs: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/71102170/hardinfo_report.html

I've been having the exact same issue on both my 32 and 64 bit Linux versions. I'm not entirely certain why, but disabling the SM3 Terrain Shaders from the settings menu and resetting the program seems to work. Granted the ground does look strange, but I think that's just because of the missing shaders. At least the ground is visible.
